result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Discovery in the most recent file had not been received or reviewed. 
Defense would need a new global offer and will likely request a PSI at a plea hearing.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Proposed Protective order

ADDRESS INFO for Joshua J Witt
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, co Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 04-11-2022)
Prior: 9110 W Mount Vernon Ave, Milwaukee, WI 53226

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Court orders a protective order pursuant to 940.47 for Victim A listed in the Victim Identification Key.  Court further orders the protective order to be sealed.  Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 2 mile of Victim A, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 3 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with drug testing through WCS.  Drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols.  Defendant to pay costs for drug testing.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

01:58 PM Defendant Joshua J Witt in court, in custody, with attorney Justin G Griffis.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 09:15 am.
